results.title: Early Treatment With Metformin in a Mice Model of Complex Regional Pain Syndrome Reduces Pain and Edema.
results.text_hl: The objective of this study is to determine if treatment with @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ during the first 3 weeks after @DISEASE_Fractures_Bone @DISEASE_MESH:D050723 @@@fracture@@@ would produce a long-term decrease in @DISEASE_Hyperalgesia @DISEASE_MESH:D006930 @@@mechanical allodynia@@@ and improve a complex behavioral task (burrowing) in a @SPECIES_10090 @@@mouse@@@ @<m>DISEASE_Absence_of_Tibia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C535563 @@@tibia fracture@@@ model with signs of @DISEASE_Complex_Regional_Pain_Syndromes @DISEASE_MESH:D020918 @@@complex regional pain syndrome@@@.

citations.NLM: Das V, Kroin JS, Moric M, McCarthy RJ, Buvanendran A. Early Treatment With Metformin in a Mice Model of Complex Regional Pain Syndrome Reduces Pain and Edema. Anesth Analg. 2020 Feb;130(2):525-534. PMID: 30801357
